intro: Macroule coutinhoi, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
